title: To hell with leather: why the car industry is (slowly) going vegan
text:
Vegan interiors are one of those things that can be instantly misunderstood. It’s too easy to hear the phrase and imagine hemp roof lining, reed mats and vegetative upholstery, and to casually dismiss it as a scratchy unpleasantness that can only be improved with layers of cow.

The truth is very different, and ­refreshingly much brighter and simpler. In fact, vegan interiors need not be pious at all. What’s more, they are claimed to offer a broader range of finishes and textures than we enjoy in today’s mostly leather-bound interiors.

To state the obvious, vegan interiors have to be totally leather-free, which can be hard to find given the prevalence of leather steering wheels and gear levers...
